units.title: Generate uterine cell map
units.text: We were able to generate a uterine map of 98,568 cells from 15 individuals by integrating our dataset with previous scRNA-seq data obtained from superficial endometrial biopsies22 (Fig. 1b, Extended Data Fig. 1b–f and Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Describes the core data‑generation step for the study.

units.title: Validate spatial expression with smFISH
units.text: Single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) with RNAscope probes shows higher expression of the proliferative marker MKI67 in the superficial layer of the endometrium during the proliferative phase, validating Visium data (Extended Data Fig. 5a).
units.rationale: Provides an experimental validation of spatial transcriptomics.

units.title: Measure intercellular communication
units.text: We develop CellPhoneDB v.3.0 to measure intercellular communication taking into account spatial coordinates of cells and use this tool to define cell signaling in both lumenal and glandular microenvironments.
units.rationale: Specifies the computational tool used to infer cell‑cell interactions.

units.title: Spatial profiling with Visium
units.text: We used 10x Visium slides and high-resolution microscopy to define specific spatial coordinates for these SOX9 subsets.
units.rationale: Details the spatial transcriptomics platform and imaging approach.

units.title: Combined scRNA‑seq, snRNA‑seq, and Visium
units.text: Samples were analyzed by single-cell transcriptomics—single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq)—alongside spatial transcriptomics methods (10x Genomics Visium slides and high-resolution microscopy).

units.title: Integrate single‑cell and spatial data
units.text: We performed integration and rely on the computational integration of coupled single-cell and spatial transcriptional profiling using our recently developed cell2location algorithm.
units.rationale: Describes the algorithmic integration of modalities.

units.title: Generate endometrial organoids
units.text: We generated three-dimensional endometrial organoids at single-cell resolution to characterize their hormonal responses in vitro and design a computational toolkit to compare the results with those observed in vivo to benchmark this model system.
units.rationale: Explains the creation of an in‑vitro model for functional testing.

units.title: Modulate WNT and NOTCH pathways in organoids
units.text: We modulated WNT and NOTCH pathways in the organoid cultures, we develop lineage-specific endometrial epithelial cells and define the molecular events involved in their response to ovarian hormones.
units.rationale: Specifies the experimental manipulation of signaling pathways.

units.title: Subcluster immune cells to resolve heterogeneity
units.text: We performed subclustering of immune cells to resolve heterogeneity, including identification of the three uterine natural killer cell subsets.
units.rationale: Details a downstream analytical step to refine cell type definitions.
